action: I want to accurately apply for reimbursement of expenses such as transportation, lodging, and supplies with supporting evidence
reason: To receive approval and accounting processing in accordance with company regulations
acceptance_criteria: Expense application is only executable by authenticated users.
Applications are linked to the user's own account.
Application IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
The expense category (Transportation / Lodging / Entertainment / Supplies / Other) is mandatory.
Expense categories are selected from a master table.
The amount can only be entered in numeric format.
The amount must be greater than 0.
The currency unit can be selected as the corporate standard or foreign currency.
Exchange rate records are saved when a foreign currency is entered.
The usage date (expenditure date) cannot be a future date.
The usage date is a mandatory input.
The payee (store name / company name) is a mandatory input.
The explanation of the payment must be at least 10 characters.
Attachment of a receipt image or PDF is mandatory.
Attached files are subject to virus scanning.
Attached files are stored in tamper-proof storage.
A maximum file size limit is set (e.g., 10MB).
File formats are restricted to jpg, png, and pdf.
Amount, date, and store name are extracted via OCR processing.
A warning is displayed if there is a discrepancy between OCR results and input values.
Applications can be saved as drafts.
Drafts do not proceed to the approval flow.
Validation is executed at the time of submission.
A warning or automatic rejection flag is added if the amount exceeds the regulation limit.
Duplicate applications with the same date and amount are detected.
A confirmation dialog is displayed upon detection of suspected duplicates.
Applications are linked to department codes.
Linking with project codes is possible.
The cost center information is saved.
An upper-level approval flow starts upon application submission.
Application status is managed as Draft / Submitted / Approved / Rejected / Paid.
The status change history is saved.
Application data is saved under transaction management.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Successful application logs are stored.
Failed application logs are stored.
Logs include operating user ID, IP address, and timestamp.
Expense data can be sent to an accounting system integration API.
Integration failures are stored in a retry queue.
Editing is prohibited once the expense is finalized.
Viewing is possible even in a non-editable state.
Withdrawal of the application is possible only before approval.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Internal DB information is not included in the API response.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Target response time for the application API is within 500ms.
Data storage character encoding is unified in UTF-8.
Expense application data is stored according to the retention period policy.
Personal information is stored in encrypted storage.
A notification event is issued upon successful expense application.
Notifications are processed via an asynchronous message queue.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Integration with machine learning scoring is implemented for auditing and fraud detection.
